quit 11:53 <ravigarg27> has joined #phenotips 12:17 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 12:24 <marta> hi ravigarg27 12:25 <marta> sorry for not having a google hangout today, it was a busy morning 12:26 <marta> ad it will be a busy day... 12:28 <ravigarg27> has quit 12:43 <mfiume> has quit 14:50 <ravigarg27> has joined #phenotips 14:51 <ravigarg27> hey sdumitriu1, got the mail, thanx 14:51 <sdumitriu1> You're welcome 14:55 <ravigarg27> just one question where should the xml files be placed, is it in the src/main/resources folder of the component 14:55 <sdumitriu1> Yes 14:55 <ravigarg27> okay 14:55 <sdumitriu1> Well, it depends on how you use them 14:55 <sdumitriu1> If you put them in there, they'll end up inside the jar 14:56 <sdumitriu1> So you'll have to open them with the class loader, getResourceAsStream 14:57 <ravigarg27> I dont need them after initialisation of analysis engine 14:57 <ravigarg27> ohh okay 14:59 <ravigarg27> well just one thing more how do you debug the java code of component 15:00 <ravigarg27> can we code that in eclipse 15:01 <sdumitriu1> Yes 15:02 <sdumitriu1> In start.sh: 15:02 <sdumitriu1> + Â START_OPTS="-Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=192m -Xdebug -Xnoagent -Djava.compiler=NONE -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,server=y,suspend=n,address=5005" 15:03 <sdumitriu1> Then you have to debug the module as a "Remote Java Application" 15:04 <ravigarg27> ohh okay will try that soon 15:19 <ravigarg27> also once I am done with the component thing, do I require to have SolrService.xml kind of file which makes a call to the component or can I directly can I directly make a call from javascript 15:19 <ravigarg27> oops typo 15:54 <ravigarg27> has quit 16:24 <bvancea> has quit 17:13 <sdumitriu1> has quit
